author: suburbandad_
content:
quick question regarding json-rpc EIPs:
there are a few outstanding 1559 json-rpc changes that should be reflected in the eth1 spec (at least).  We have a few existing EIPs for some of these changes on a per-endpoint basis, such as:
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3041
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3044
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3045
https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-3046

and there are a handful of other endpoints that need changes but do not have EIPs.  However, as most of the changes are to `result`  I think they can be consolidated to a few individual schema changes to #components in the eth1 spec repo.  

Could/should we make EIPs against the json-rpc spec components or should we be submitting individual EIPs against each json-rpc endpoint that would have its result payload changed?

author: timbeiko
content:
<@!524738020033691659> AIUI, we wanted to move away from EIPs for this and have everything in here https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/blob/master/json-rpc/spec.json

I _think_ everything related to 1559 is covered, but <@!543900561460822016> or <@!104006934562107392> can confirm.

author: timbeiko
content: I'm not sure what we should do about the existing EIPs, though ðŸ¤”

author: suburbandad_
content:
I believe we still need changes to :
#/components/schemas/Block
#/components/schemas/Transaction
#/components/schemas/Receipt

author: timbeiko
content: What is missing? I'm looking now and the `Block` seems to have the `baseFeePerGas`, and transactions have `maxFeePerGas` along with `maxPriorityFeePerGas`

author: timbeiko
content: I'm not up to date on what we agreed receipts should/should not have ðŸ˜…

author: suburbandad_
content: edit: doh

author: suburbandad_
content: in besu at least we have baseFee rather than baseFeePerGas

author: timbeiko
content: A few weeks ago we agreed to use the terms from the spec in JSON RPC as well (`baseFeePerGas`, `priorityFeePerGas`, `maxFeePerGas`)

author: timbeiko
content: I'm not sure all clients have updated, though

author: suburbandad_
content: gasPrice is required though?

author: suburbandad_
content:
```     "Transaction": {
        "title": "transaction",
        "type": "object",
        "required": [
          "gas",
          "gasPrice",
          "nonce"
        ],
```

author: timbeiko
content: Yeah, that seems wrong! Especially because below `gasPrice` is clearly `oneOf` https://github.com/ethereum/eth1.0-specs/blob/master/json-rpc/spec.json#L1622

author: suburbandad_
content: generally, if there are changes to the eth1 json-rpc spec, do we need an EIP or just a PR?

author: timbeiko
content: In the past an EIP, but we've moved (are moving ðŸ˜… !) to just PRs/issues

author: suburbandad_
content: that seems right sized, but wanted to be sure

author: timbeiko
content: Def worth opening an issue for what you just posted, as I believe it's wrong, but I could also be misreading the "format" of the spec

author: suburbandad_
content: and we can treat this spec as canonical?  like I can refer to it for reference tests correctness?

author: timbeiko
content: Yes, that's the goal

author: timbeiko
content: It's still new, so there may be bugs, but it should at least have all the latest "features" (e.g. 1559) which no previous json rpc spec had

author: timbeiko
content: BTW, does the Receipt object look roughly right?

author: suburbandad_
content: IDK - Abdel created a ticket to make changes to the json-rpc spec for it, and I recall there were conversations about having 1559 related fields like baseFee in the receipt, but IDK if that is still on the table or not

content: #londonreadiness

content: the spec agrees with our receipt implementation currently afaict
